pageContext.description:
The Virgin is shown seated as a half-length figure in a red robe. The infant Christ on her lap grasps at the grapes offered to him from the left by the infant St John. A dark curtain is held by two angels behind the figure.
[Görres, cda 2016]

Dimensions of support: 72.3 x 49.5 cm
[Cat. Dublin 1987, 11, No. 1278]

metadata.title: The Virgin and Child with the infant John the Baptist and angels

pageContext.provenance:
- Monsignor J. Shine, Dublin
- purchased, April 1954

[Cat. Dublin 1987, 11, No. 1278]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
'The painting of the Virgin and Child was transferred at an unknown date from its original (presumably wooden) support to the thin layer of linen. The linen is attached to three vertical panels of modern plywood. The slightly uneven balance between the right and left sides of the picture suggests that the right border of the linen may have been trimmed by a few centimetres. 
The paint surface is in poor condition. There are several vertical cracks in the surface, including two which extend the length of the paintings at 10.7 cms and 24.1 cms from the left border. The paint is particularly thin on the faces of Christ and the Virgin. The Virgin's neck and robe have been considerably retouched and there is extensive craquelure in the black dress and the black hanging. Discolouration of the varnish is also apparent. The painting was restored in 1955.'

[Cat. Dublin 1987, 11, No. 1278]

restorationSurveys.remarks:
'The painting was restored in 1955.'

[Cat. Dublin 1987, 11, No. 1278]
